result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L Sephus

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony L Sephus in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Anthony L Sephus.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken for Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Defense advises of pending resolution with the State and requests adjourned plea and sentencing date be set.  Counsel to file plea documents at least 3 days prior to next hearing date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Anthony L Sephus in court.  Attorney Angel L Johnson for Arial Rosenberg in court for Anthony L Sephus.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick T. Franken for Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense requests a projected guilty plea date be set. Case adjourned to Br. 9. Plea hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing (17 pages) commencing 06-14-2022, by Katherine M. Nelson.

Defendant Anthony L Sephus in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests additional time to review the digital discovery.  Court grants request and sets this for Adjourned Scheduling conference.
Matter adjourned to Br. 9.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L Sephus in court, appear in person with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Driscolo.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17. Cout advised defendant to continue corporation with Justice Point. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-13-2022

Defendant Anthony L Sephus in court by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anthony L Sephus in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Anthony L Sephus in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony L Sephus appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
